alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 12:49AM CST until December 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Flint Creek near Kansas. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, minor flooding occurs from Fidlers Bend to Chewey Bridge. Permanent campgrounds and farmlands are affected. Turbulence makes the river unsafe for floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM CST Saturday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.1 feet this morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
